overview: The film, based on the life story of actor Tamer Naffar, also starring in the eyes of Karim, is a young Palestinian living in a slum in Lod and trying to make his way with his beloved singer in the music world. He does not provide criticism against anyone: he criticizes the Arab community - his criticism of violence, oppression of women and crime in the Arab sector in Israel, which many people are paying for their lives, and also of the Jewish society and racism and hatred there, and Israeli law that does not recognize the rights Displaced people in their homes. Karim, the hero of the film, fervently claims that his songs are not political, but simply reflect the reality of his life. In one of the songs in which Karim says words in Hebrew, the phrase "Ana Mesh Politi" is repeated, meaning "Politi" in Hebrew, "politician", and in another song, "Ya Reit", he quotes words about Mahmoud Darwish.
title: مفرق 48
